actions.text: Read twice and referred jointly to the Committees on Budget; Governmental Affairs pursuant to the order of August 4, 1977, to the Committee on the Budget and Governmental Affairs, with instructions that if one Committee reports, the other Committee have thirty days of continuous session to report or be discharged.
Committee on Budget. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Budget. Reported to Senate by Senator Sasser under the authority of the order of Aug 2, 90 without amendment. With written report No. 101-437. Minority views filed.
Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs discharged. Pursuant to the order of August 4, 1977.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 888.

official_title: A bill to amend the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to require the President and Congress to set, on an annual basis, the ratio of defense versus nondefense spending reductions required under sequestration.

summary.text: National Priorities Review Act - Amends the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (Gramm-Rudman-Hollings Act) to provide that the sequestration ratio between defense and non-defense programs be determined annually (through FY 1993) by congressional passage of a joint resolution containing such ratio. Requires an allocation of outlay reductions of one-half defense programs and one-half non-defense programs upon failure to enact such joint resolution.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to require the President and Congress to set, on an annual basis, the ratio of defense versus nondefense spending reductions required under sequestration.
